summary: Daniel Flores was a CIA employee, as evidenced by multiple documents. A Personal History Statement from 1961 details his background, education, employment, military service, and language abilities. In 1975, the CIA's General Counsel requested he be excused from jury duty in Fairfax County to maintain confidentiality. Appointment Affidavits from 1962 show Flores swearing to support the Constitution and denying subversive activities. A 1974 Supplemental Personal History Statement provides additional personal details. He is also mentioned in a memo regarding the transfer of AMMUG to a new apartment, suggesting his involvement in related operations.
significance: The documents suggest Daniel Flores was a CIA employee involved in potentially sensitive operations, given the request to excuse him from jury duty and his connection to the AMMUG transfer. While the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, his CIA affiliation and involvement in covert activities could be of interest in understanding the broader context of the event.
